article:
Some people like to put their life in order.They are never late for work, they return their books to the library on time, they _  people's birthdays and they pay their bills as soon as they arrive.Mr. Robinson is  _  a person.
Mr. Robinson works at a bank and lives alone.His sister live in the next town with her husband, and her son, Jack.Mr. Robinson doesn't visit his sister or her  _ from one year to the next, but he  _  Christmas cards to them, and he hasn't forgotten each one of Jack's 20 birthdays.
Last week Mr. Robinson drove home from the bank at the  _  time, driving neither too slow nor too fast.He parked his car where he  _  parked it, out of the way of other cars and he went into the house to make  _  evening meal.Just then there was a knock  _ the door.Mr. Robinson opened the door and found a policeman standing on the doorstep .
"What have I  _  wrong?" Mr. Robinson asked himself in surprise, "Have I driven on the wrong side of the road? Has there been any trouble at the _ ? Have I forgotten to pay an important bill?"
"Hello, Uncle," said the policeman, "My name's Jack!"
